If the patient self-reports significant pain or PGHO is low or the patient carries allele AVY0, then lab UOB7 will be low (less than 0.69 mg/dL). If the patient self-reports significant pain or PGHO is low or UOB7 is low or the patient has a family history of LBQT, then lab V4SB will be low (less than 3.19 mg/dL). If V4SB is low or the patient has previously received surgery for EM8D, then vital Q9PR will be low (less than 3.36 mg/dL). If V4SB is low or Q9PR is low or the patient carries allele 5CDN, then lab BR85 will be low (less than 1.69 mg/dL). If V4SB is low or Q9PR is low or BR85 is low or the patient has a family history of N937, then lab UVXF will be elevated (greater than 1.96 mg/dL). If UVXF is elevated or the patient has a family history of NH8X, then lab UJ5J will be low (less than 2.44 mg/dL). If UVXF is elevated or UJ5J is low or the patient has a family history of FFW3, then lab JJPF will be elevated (greater than 1.57 mg/dL). If UVXF is elevated and UJ5J is low and JJPF is elevated and the patient has previously received surgery for FEJE, then the surgeon will recommend surgery. Assume that all factors influencing the surgeon are fully described here.

If UVXF is elevated or UJ5J is low or the patient has a family history of FFW3, then lab JJPF will be elevated (greater than 1.57 mg/dL). If UVXF is elevated and UJ5J is low and JJPF is elevated and the patient has previously received surgery for FEJE, then the surgeon will recommend surgery. If UVXF is elevated or UJ5J is low or the patient has a family history of FFW3, then lab JJPF will be elevated (greater than 1.57 mg/dL). Causal context: Chronic disease N9KAOX sometimes requires surgical intervention, depending on genetics, patient history, vital signs, and lab results. The patient will experience significant pain (rated greater than or equal to 8/10) if they carry allele GT81, a genetic marker for severe N9KAOX. If the patient self-reports significant pain or the patient carries allele KG95, then vital RJS8 will be low (less than 0.25 mg/dL). If the patient self-reports significant pain or RJS8 is low or the patient has a family history of MELA, then lab TTW1 will be elevated (greater than 1.2 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or the patient carries allele M348, then vital OT3C will be elevated (greater than 2.97 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or OT3C is elevated or the patient carries allele 4Y2Y, then lab OVYI will be low (less than 2.28 mg/dL). If OVYI is low or the patient carries allele DLY7, then vital PF2V will be low (less than 1.63 mg/dL). If OVYI is low and PF2V is low and the patient has a family history of PQK1, then the surgeon will recommend surgery. Assume that all factors influencing the surgeon are fully described here.

If UVXF is elevated or the patient has a family history of NH8X, then lab UJ5J will be low (less than 2.44 mg/dL). If UVXF is elevated or UJ5J is low or the patient has a family history of FFW3, then lab JJPF will be elevated (greater than 1.57 mg/dL). Causal context: Chronic disease N9KAOX sometimes requires surgical intervention, depending on genetics, patient history, vital signs, and lab results. The patient will experience significant pain (rated greater than or equal to 8/10) if they carry allele GT81, a genetic marker for severe N9KAOX. If the patient self-reports significant pain or the patient carries allele KG95, then vital RJS8 will be low (less than 0.25 mg/dL). If the patient self-reports significant pain or RJS8 is low or the patient has a family history of MELA, then lab TTW1 will be elevated (greater than 1.2 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or the patient carries allele M348, then vital OT3C will be elevated (greater than 2.97 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or OT3C is elevated or the patient carries allele 4Y2Y, then lab OVYI will be low (less than 2.28 mg/dL). If OVYI is low or the patient carries allele DLY7, then vital PF2V will be low (less than 1.63 mg/dL). If OVYI is low and PF2V is low and the patient has a family history of PQK1, then the surgeon will recommend surgery. Assume that all factors influencing the surgeon are fully described here.

Causal context: Chronic disease N9KAOX sometimes requires surgical intervention, depending on genetics, patient history, vital signs, and lab results. The patient will experience significant pain (rated greater than or equal to 8/10) if they carry allele GT81, a genetic marker for severe N9KAOX. If the patient self-reports significant pain or the patient carries allele KG95, then vital RJS8 will be low (less than 0.25 mg/dL). If the patient self-reports significant pain or RJS8 is low or the patient has a family history of MELA, then lab TTW1 will be elevated (greater than 1.2 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or the patient carries allele M348, then vital OT3C will be elevated (greater than 2.97 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or OT3C is elevated or the patient carries allele 4Y2Y, then lab OVYI will be low (less than 2.28 mg/dL). If OVYI is low or the patient carries allele DLY7, then vital PF2V will be low (less than 1.63 mg/dL). If OVYI is low and PF2V is low and the patient has a family history of PQK1, then the surgeon will recommend surgery. Assume that all factors influencing the surgeon are fully described here.

Causal context: Chronic disease N9KAOX sometimes requires surgical intervention, depending on genetics, patient history, vital signs, and lab results. The patient will experience significant pain (rated greater than or equal to 8/10) if they carry allele GT81, a genetic marker for severe N9KAOX. If the patient self-reports significant pain or the patient carries allele KG95, then vital RJS8 will be low (less than 0.25 mg/dL). If the patient self-reports significant pain or RJS8 is low or the patient has a family history of MELA, then lab TTW1 will be elevated (greater than 1.2 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or the patient carries allele M348, then vital OT3C will be elevated (greater than 2.97 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or OT3C is elevated or the patient carries allele 4Y2Y, then lab OVYI will be low (less than 2.28 mg/dL). If OVYI is low or the patient carries allele DLY7, then vital PF2V will be low (less than 1.63 mg/dL). If OVYI is low and PF2V is low and the patient has a family history of PQK1, then the surgeon will recommend surgery. Assume that all factors influencing the surgeon are fully described here.

If OVYI is low or the patient carries allele DLY7, then vital PF2V will be low (less than 1.63 mg/dL). If OVYI is low and PF2V is low and the patient has a family history of PQK1, then the surgeon will recommend surgery. Assume that all factors influencing the surgeon are fully described here.

Causal context: Chronic disease N9KAOX sometimes requires surgical intervention, depending on genetics, patient history, vital signs, and lab results. The patient will experience significant pain (rated greater than or equal to 8/10) if they carry allele GT81, a genetic marker for severe N9KAOX. If the patient self-reports significant pain or the patient carries allele KG95, then vital RJS8 will be low (less than 0.25 mg/dL). If the patient self-reports significant pain or RJS8 is low or the patient has a family history of MELA, then lab TTW1 will be elevated (greater than 1.2 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or the patient carries allele M348, then vital OT3C will be elevated (greater than 2.97 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or OT3C is elevated or the patient carries allele 4Y2Y, then lab OVYI will be low (less than 2.28 mg/dL). If OVYI is low or the patient carries allele DLY7, then vital PF2V will be low (less than 1.63 mg/dL). If OVYI is low and PF2V is low and the patient has a family history of PQK1, then the surgeon will recommend surgery. Assume that all factors influencing the surgeon are fully described here.

Causal context: Chronic disease XNXDTV sometimes requires surgical intervention, depending on genetics, patient history, vital signs, and lab results. The patient will experience significant pain (rated greater than or equal to 8/10) if they carry allele PLD7, a genetic marker for severe XNXDTV. If the patient self-reports significant pain or the patient carries allele OYZC, then lab PGHO will be low (less than 1.68 mg/dL). If the patient self-reports significant pain or PGHO is low or the patient carries allele AVY0, then lab UOB7 will be low (less than 0.69 mg/dL). If the patient self-reports significant pain or PGHO is low or UOB7 is low or the patient has a family history of LBQT, then lab V4SB will be low (less than 3.19 mg/dL). If V4SB is low or the patient has previously received surgery for EM8D, then vital Q9PR will be low (less than 3.36 mg/dL). If V4SB is low or Q9PR is low or the patient carries allele 5CDN, then lab BR85 will be low (less than 1.69 mg/dL). If V4SB is low or Q9PR is low or BR85 is low or the patient has a family history of N937, then lab UVXF will be elevated (greater than 1.96 mg/dL). If UVXF is elevated or the patient has a family history of NH8X, then lab UJ5J will be low (less than 2.44 mg/dL). If UVXF is elevated or UJ5J is low or the patient has a family history of FFW3, then lab JJPF will be elevated (greater than 1.57 mg/dL). If UVXF is elevated and UJ5J is low and JJPF is elevated and the patient has previously received surgery for FEJE, then the surgeon will recommend surgery. Assume that all factors influencing the surgeon are fully described here.

Causal context: Chronic disease N9KAOX sometimes requires surgical intervention, depending on genetics, patient history, vital signs, and lab results. The patient will experience significant pain (rated greater than or equal to 8/10) if they carry allele GT81, a genetic marker for severe N9KAOX. If the patient self-reports significant pain or the patient carries allele KG95, then vital RJS8 will be low (less than 0.25 mg/dL). If the patient self-reports significant pain or RJS8 is low or the patient has a family history of MELA, then lab TTW1 will be elevated (greater than 1.2 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or the patient carries allele M348, then vital OT3C will be elevated (greater than 2.97 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or OT3C is elevated or the patient carries allele 4Y2Y, then lab OVYI will be low (less than 2.28 mg/dL). If OVYI is low or the patient carries allele DLY7, then vital PF2V will be low (less than 1.63 mg/dL). If OVYI is low and PF2V is low and the patient has a family history of PQK1, then the surgeon will recommend surgery. Assume that all factors influencing the surgeon are fully described here.

If the patient self-reports significant pain or the patient carries allele OYZC, then lab PGHO will be low (less than 1.68 mg/dL). If the patient self-reports significant pain or PGHO is low or the patient carries allele AVY0, then lab UOB7 will be low (less than 0.69 mg/dL). If the patient self-reports significant pain or PGHO is low or UOB7 is low or the patient has a family history of LBQT, then lab V4SB will be low (less than 3.19 mg/dL). If V4SB is low or the patient has previously received surgery for EM8D, then vital Q9PR will be low (less than 3.36 mg/dL). If V4SB is low or Q9PR is low or the patient carries allele 5CDN, then lab BR85 will be low (less than 1.69 mg/dL). If V4SB is low or Q9PR is low or BR85 is low or the patient has a family history of N937, then lab UVXF will be elevated (greater than 1.96 mg/dL). If UVXF is elevated or the patient has a family history of NH8X, then lab UJ5J will be low (less than 2.44 mg/dL). If UVXF is elevated or UJ5J is low or the patient has a family history of FFW3, then lab JJPF will be elevated (greater than 1.57 mg/dL). If UVXF is elevated and UJ5J is low and JJPF is elevated and the patient has previously received surgery for FEJE, then the surgeon will recommend surgery. Assume that all factors influencing the surgeon are fully described here.

Causal context: Chronic disease N9KAOX sometimes requires surgical intervention, depending on genetics, patient history, vital signs, and lab results. The patient will experience significant pain (rated greater than or equal to 8/10) if they carry allele GT81, a genetic marker for severe N9KAOX. If the patient self-reports significant pain or the patient carries allele KG95, then vital RJS8 will be low (less than 0.25 mg/dL). If the patient self-reports significant pain or RJS8 is low or the patient has a family history of MELA, then lab TTW1 will be elevated (greater than 1.2 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or the patient carries allele M348, then vital OT3C will be elevated (greater than 2.97 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or OT3C is elevated or the patient carries allele 4Y2Y, then lab OVYI will be low (less than 2.28 mg/dL). If OVYI is low or the patient carries allele DLY7, then vital PF2V will be low (less than 1.63 mg/dL). If OVYI is low and PF2V is low and the patient has a family history of PQK1, then the surgeon will recommend surgery. Assume that all factors influencing the surgeon are fully described here.

If UVXF is elevated or the patient has a family history of NH8X, then lab UJ5J will be low (less than 2.44 mg/dL). If UVXF is elevated or UJ5J is low or the patient has a family history of FFW3, then lab JJPF will be elevated (greater than 1.57 mg/dL). If V4SB is low or the patient has previously received surgery for EM8D, then vital Q9PR will be low (less than 3.36 mg/dL). If V4SB is low or Q9PR is low or the patient carries allele 5CDN, then lab BR85 will be low (less than 1.69 mg/dL). If V4SB is low or Q9PR is low or BR85 is low or the patient has a family history of N937, then lab UVXF will be elevated (greater than 1.96 mg/dL). If UVXF is elevated or the patient has a family history of NH8X, then lab UJ5J will be low (less than 2.44 mg/dL). If UVXF is elevated or UJ5J is low or the patient has a family history of FFW3, then lab JJPF will be elevated (greater than 1.57 mg/dL). If UVXF is elevated and UJ5J is low and JJPF is elevated and the patient has previously received surgery for FEJE, then the surgeon will recommend surgery. Assume that all factors influencing the surgeon are fully described here.

If the patient self-reports significant pain or RJS8 is low or the patient has a family history of MELA, then lab TTW1 will be elevated (greater than 1.2 mg/dL). If OVYI is low or the patient carries allele DLY7, then vital PF2V will be low (less than 1.63 mg/dL). If OVYI is low and PF2V is low and the patient has a family history of PQK1, then the surgeon will recommend surgery. Assume that all factors influencing the surgeon are fully described here.
